comments.body: I agree, if you have to that came by luck logically if you feed the both a baby parrot should be born.

Interesting idea

Haha! This is terrifying and I love it.
Great idea!

Agreed! And as far as I know it would already work in the game. Witches should be the ideal mob for a phantom jockey rider since their instant damage potions would heal their mount even if they hit it. Other mobs like skeletons would tend to shoot their phantoms in the back when aiming down. It could be a fun miniboss!

I have to agree with this.

Also Piglins that wander into other dimensions, or spawn zombified, should be able to be cured with weakness and golden apple (or carrot?) and then permanently have the immune to zombification tag.

Parents being able to pass this on, like fox breeding.

I Like this Idea, but I think it should be more complicated than just giving piglins pork chops. Maybe between normal mob breeding and villager breeding?

Maybe Piglins would need any meat (with pork chops being the best) to be willing to breed, and have bartered recently (gold ingot in its inventory) and willingness would be he probability of a piglin breeding?

1 porkchop would increase willingness by F 20 (food ten), any other meat items would increase willingness by F 10, gold ingots would increase willingness by G 20 (gold 20), gold nuggets would increase willingness by G 2, carrots would increase willingness by F 2, golden carrots would increase willingness by G 30 and F 30, and any other food item would decrease willingness by F 10 and be immediately eaten. 

when a piglin's inventory food is greater than F 50, the piglin will have a 50% chance of breeding with another willing piglin (willingness would need to be greater than 50% for breeding to be possible). all food in the piglin's inventory will be eaten even if the piglin does not successfully breed.

When a piglin's inventory gold is greater than G 50, it will have a 50% chance, with everything being the same as food, except only half of a piglin's gold will be consumed.

If a piglin's inventory is greater than F 50 and G 50, then a piglin will breed with any other willing piglin, and consume half of its food and 1/4 of its gold.
why did you make the example be porkchop if they are porkchops
aaronthehuman36 porkchops from hunting hoglins is in fact, a staple for piglins and piglins do consume the porkchop dropped from hoglins after a hunt.
I agree with this idea, however to justify the floating island this wouldn't work, maybe instead of it floating have it spawn with a thick tree of its specific type holding up the island.
This would be an awesome mob I love this idea
Maybe it should just fall, man?
it sounds like a challenge
it sounds good

This seems a bit generic, as just about every other open-world "fantasy" game has a wolf mount. Still, it would be neat seeing it implemented in a way unique to Minecraft - perhaps if lightning strikes a wolf, it becomes a giant one?

It would be like our version of the ravager maybe? Prehaps a little weaker?

I love the idea! Its really satisfying having an army of allies willing to fight alongside you. Especially powerful ones like this idea or dragons

100% support!

sounds interesting. but this should have some sort of limit. maybe they'll only patrol if you feed them meat, and each piece of meat fed is an in-game day patrolling. and wolves shouldn't hurt other players unless the player hurts the wolf. other then that, great idea.

I'd suggest tweaking this. Wolves should wander by default (like horses). If you want them to follow you, maybe create a collar item that causes them to follow only when it's worn? Or add a command to all tames creatures to "stay/follow" as the current "sit" mechanic makes tames pets very boring.

They should do this for cats too, and any other tamable mob they add that can be given a given a follow/sit command.

Edit: responce to other commenter: Having to bribe your pet to freeroam dosn't make much sense to me.

(If anything, a pet would be more likely switch to patroll mode on their own to hunt, if not properly fed; which I'm NOT sugesting be added either.)
If possible, could you add what the zedonks and zorses should look like?

Of course! there are a lot of different colors that they can have, but here are pictures of a zedonk and zorse. The zorse is the one that is half white, and the zedonk is the one with the stripes on its legs.

Hey, good idea.

I think this is a great idea, especially for all platforms. We definitely need draft horses and maybe more variants of colours of horses aswell like an appaloosa?

Yes to the sea turtles, no to the bottle nose dolphins.
That kinda' sounds cruel...
Or make it to where you can change the colors of each section of the parrot.

Yes and more natural variation to represent the varied species of parrots there are. The african grey and green cheek conures are among my favorite, would love them! Maybe african greys can be the rarest since they are the smartest.
Please, add more parrot colors. That would be great
Very cool idea and I hope to see it implemented in the game in future updates!
Great idea for an animal in the end.

I think this is a great idea! We NEED more dog breeds, even though I'm more of a cat person I do think that the cats are hogging the spotlight a little. Also, we should be able to set pets to wander mode, I would help so much in my cousin's realm!!

and wither skeletons should drop wither roses as a rare drop. (same rarity as a wither skull)

What is the purpose of wither bone meal
Yes, right now the potion of decay is a bedrock-creative inventory exclusive.
such a weird idea, its perfect!

I love this! I feel like them stealing items is a little too frustrating, but perhaps them hitting you for half a heart might make sense, mostly for the knocking factor of getting hit. Its not a huge drawback but it is harmfull and if your near lave, its has potential to kill, but it might not happen often. Seeing this is a nether mob it might be cool to tame them with a golden apple or something. I do like the idea of them being tricksters though so im not sure how that could be kept if you get rid of theft. Perhaps instead its just easier to get your stuff back, maybe by cornering them they throw it back?

I really really don’t want to deal with mobs that steal items from you, but I do think maybe they could just hit you. It would be even more evil if they could see you from further away if you have really low health!

I agree as when they revamped the Ender Dragon to be harder in Java Edition by adding the Bedrock/Console Edition's cages and dragons breath, it was a tougher fight and more fun. I think the Wither in Java edition is much too easy  compared to its Bedrock Counterpart. Of course, the Wither skeletons it spawns shouldn't be able to drop Wither skulls to prevent recursive farming via bedrock trapping.

Agreed! The Wither fight in Bedrock feels more like a boss fight with additional health and new attacks like dashing/summoning. It's much more rewarding to fight.

On the other hand, Java Withers are boring and disappointingly weak. You can even make Java Withers stuck in Nether ceilings.
Hi, can you explain what you're looking for this to do beyond cosmetic changes? Thanks, it will help us express your idea to the team in an actionable way.

Ok sure. They could have different drop items. The changes in the textures could allow them to blend in making it so you cant just hide in your base and shoot them till they die. Ones not in plains could try to hide in areas where you wont notice them then come out to attack you. 

For drop items ones in swaps can drop:

0-3 vines

Jungle 

0-3 vines 0-2 cocoa beans and 0-3 sticks

Snow Biomes

1-3 snowballs and 0-2 sticks
Deer, bears, lions tigers, sharks alligators, crocodiles,Unicorn Pegasus or both different birds
Doves of peace and sand star.
